title: Rustc crashes with nul byte inside inline assembly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code #### Fails ```rust #![feature(asm)] fn main() { unsafe { asm!(".ascii \"Xen\0\""); } } ``` #### Works ```rust #![feature(asm)] fn main() { unsafe { asm!(".ascii \"Xen\\0\""); } } ``` ```rust #![feature(asm)] fn main() { unsafe { asm!(".asciz \"Xen\""); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.43.0-nightly (fc23a8183 2020-02-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: fc23a81831d5b41510d3261c20c34dd8d32f0f31 commit-date: 2020-02-11 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.43.0-nightly LLVM version: 9.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: NulError(11, [46, 97, 115, 99, 105, 105, 32, 34, 88, 101, 110, 0, 34])', src/librustc_codegen_llvm/asm.rs:77:19 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.43.0-nightly (fc23a8183 2020-02-11) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:88 1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66 2: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:77 3: ::fmt at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59 4: core::fmt::write at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1052 5: std::io::Write::write_fmt at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1428 6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:62 7: std::sys_common::backtrace::print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:49 8: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} at src/libstd/panicking.rs:204 9: std::panicking::default_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:224 10: rustc_driver::report_ice 11: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:474 12: rust_begin_unwind at src/libstd/panicking.rs:378 13: core::panicking::panic_fmt at src/libcore/panicking.rs:85 14: core::option::expect_none_failed at src/libcore/option.rs:1211 15: rustc_codegen_llvm::asm::::codegen_inline_asm 16: rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::block::>::codegen_block 17: rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::codegen_mir 18: ::define 19: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit::module_codegen 20: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 21: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit 22: rustc_codegen_ssa::base::codegen_crate 23: ::codegen_crate 24: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 25: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 26: rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler_in_existing_thread_pool 27: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set 28: syntax::attr::with_globals note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```

This issue has been assigned to @euclio via [this comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/69092#issuecomment-585277602).
